text: Chibi Bana: "Let's eat! Now move it, you lazy slug!"
You: "...Let's eat."
...According to the teachings of the Triple Fried Rice sect, the morning greeting is "itadakimasu."
Chibi Bana: "You... you're still weak in the mornings, huh? Then what are you even good at?"
You: "It's not like I'm physically weak or anything... but still, 2 AM is just too early..."
Chibi Bana: "You've got to be kidding! Fishermen are usually up around this time!"
Chibi Hana: "Same with bakeries, you know! It takes time from mixing to fermentation!"
You: "What are you talking about?!"
Chibi Bana: "Anyway, let's just get going."
You: "What about Tachibana? Aren't you going to invite her?"
Chibi Bana: "Sis can't wake up that early... anyway, she's busy. Let her sleep."
You: "Got it."
Chibi Bana: "Okay, since you're a beginner and night is dangerous, we'll fish somewhere with proper safety rails."
Chibi Bana: "And take care of the trash. It'd be awful for the fish if the wind blew garbage into the ocean."
Chibi Bana: "Also, you've got a life jacket, right? The ocean at night is scary without one."
You: "Alright, understood. I guess we have to act like something dangerous could happen."
Chibi Bana: "Exactly. Respect nature. Don't take it lightly. If you do, you'll come back alive. Better to be prepared than to pray, right? Lady Luck won't save you, but a life jacket will."
A few minutes later...
Chibi Bana: "Okay, let's bait the hooks! Good morning, little worms!"
You: "Eek!"
Chibi Bana: "Quiet down, will ya? What time do you think it is?!"
You: "B-but... bu-because... *sob*..."

Chibi Bana: "You pathetic thing... Listen, just man up and grab one already, okay? It's all about getting used to it. The more you handle them, the more used you'll be. Their faces aren't so bad, you know!"

Chibi Bana: "So this here is the head. And this is the mouth. You put the hook tip right in front of the mouth like this. Then these little guys will swallow the hook. Now push it through that barb here. That way the bait stays on better."
You: "...This is pretty gross."
Chibi Bana: "Well, that's just how it is. It's the circle of life, after all."
You: "Wouldn't a lure work instead?"

Chibi Bana: "Ah, lures are tricky. You see, a lure is basically a fake fish. But it doesn't move by itself. So you have to use the reel and rod to make it look like it's swimming... it's really tough to do."

Chibi Bana: "Plus, it could be that we're not handling it right, or maybe the lure just doesn't appeal to the fish here. Some fish only go for certain lures, you know? Figuring that out is a whole job in itself."
Chibi Bana: "Well, at least at first we want to catch something. So just be quiet and attach the bait."
A few minutes later...
Chibi Bana: "You said you've never gone fishing before. Didn't you ever fish as a kid?"
You: "I have tried, but all I remember is I only caught a blowfish. I figured catching something edible must be hard, so I didn't really get into it."
Chibi Bana: "Ah, I see... Filleting it and eating it afterwards is basically the main event, isn't it? It's like pachinkoâ€”those arcade versions aren't fun unless you win real money."
You (thinking): "Is this really a little girl...?"
You: "Huh?!"
You: "Wait, did something just bite?"
Chibi Bana: "Oh! Try reeling it in a bit!"
You: "Whoa?! Something's on the line?!"
Chibi Bana: "Great! Keep reeling it in like that!"
You: "Uwoooaarghhh!"
You: "Whoa?!"
Chibi Bana: "It's a goby! Nice, that's an edible fish!"
You: "Oh, cool! How do we cook it?"
Chibi Bana: "Tempura is really good. It tastes almost exactly like whiting!"
Chibi Bana: "They're usually caught in brackish water, but you can catch them in the ocean too. Really tasty fish. Nice going!"
You: "What's brackish water?"

Chibi Bana: "Fresh water is around 0–0.5‰ (rivers, lakes, etc.). Brackish water is 0.5–17‰ (estuaries, tidal flats, bays where fresh and salt water mix). Sea water is about 35‰ (normal ocean). Above 40‰ is like the Dead Sea or other enclosed salt lakes. Basically, gobies like lightly salty water."
You: "Oh! You can even eat them at restaurants? I haven't seen them around much."
Chibi Bana: "Yeah, I sometimes see them in fish tanks. But from my experience they're very rare. Well, they don't look super appealing, you know. But I like them."
You: "Oh! Another hit!"
Chibi Bana: "Nice going! That's already a good catch. And they're a nice size!"
You: "This must be a whiting, right?!"
Chibi Bana: "That's right! By the way, this fish is also called the 'Queen of the Shore'."
You: "Cool..."
Chibi Bana: "Great job! That's already a good catch."
You: "Way more wholesome than pachinko, plus it's cheap and risk-free. It's a great hobby."
Chibi Bana: "Right. Both have their merits, of course. But if you're trying to quit gambling, maybe give fishing a try?"
Chibi Bana: "I know this old guy called 'Squid Grandpa', a monster obsessed with squid fishing. When squid season comes, he fishes for hours on end, then lines them up in his fridge - his catch."
Chibi Bana: "He arranges them like he's honoring the dead. That guy's a real yōkai. He's addicted, but no one's hurt, and it costs nothing, and it becomes a skill. It's a good hobby."
Chibi Bana: "But I think playing pachinko in moderation is fine. GARO is really cool, after all."
You: "By the way, have you ever played pachinko yourself...?"
Chibi Bana: "Of course not! I'm underage!"
You: "Then how do you know so much about it?!"
Chibi Bana: "Anyway, great, great! Let's keep this up and catch as many as we need!"
You: "Huh... but, senior...? You? We haven't caught anything, have we...?"
Chibi Bana: "What the heck is up with you suddenly... trying to one-up me at every chance, that's super lame."
You: "Huh?! You were acting all high and mighty... showing off your knowledge, and yet... we haven't caught a single fish, right? Isn't that weird?"

Chibi Bana: "What the hell is wrong with you! Seizing the moment, huh! Don't screw around with me! Fine, let's make it a challenge! But not by number of fish, by total weight! If I win, I'll toss you into the ocean and feed you to the fish!"
You: "I can't take that bet! That's too scary!"
A few minutes later...
Chibi Bana: "Nothing's biting!"
You: "I got one!"
Chibi Bana: "What is this beginner's luck?! What did I ever do to you?! Hey, Lady Luck! Show yourself and give me a fair fight!"
You: "Stop it! That's beyond blasphemy!"
You: "Man, seriously..."
Chibi Bana: "What are you looking at?!"
You: "Having knowledge alone isn't enough, is it... It has to be backed up by skill, I guess..."
You: "It's like one of those old guys in an izakaya criticizing a baseball player's form..."
Old Man: "Yeah, with that form he'll never make it this year! You gotta move your hips like this...!"
You: "I'd be like, 'Then why don't you show me how it's done?'"
You: "I feel exactly the same right now."
Chibi Bana: "Aaaaargh! Sink him! Right now! I'll send you and Lady Luck straight to hell!"
You: "No to violence! Calm down, please! And watch your language!"
Chibi Bana: "Damn... I do look like a total idiot if this goes on... Seriously... huh?"
Chibi Bana: "This one's huge!!!!!"
You: "Whoa! What is this twist?!"
Chibi Bana: "And... this is bad. It might be a sea bass. The rod's going to break."
You: "What is it, that's so big?"
Chibi Bana: "Yeah... a bit of a pinch... but remember Santiago..."
Chibi Bana: "You! Bring the net (that big bug-catching kind of net)!"
You: "Okay! I got it! What should I do?!"
Chibi Bana: "I'll reel it in! I'll call the timing! Use the net then! The net is collapsible - don't open it, keep it folded!"
You: "Understood!"
Chibi Bana: "Alright! I've got it in! Now extend the net!"
You: "Yes!... Huh?"
Chibi Bana: "No way! It's a swordfish! How?!"
You: "Hey, this thing is super heavy! We can't collapse it!"
Chibi Bana: "Damn! Then it's on like this!"
Chibi Bana: "Uwoooaaaarghhh!"
You: "Whaaat?!"
Chibi Bana: "I did it! My first swordfish!"
You: "Awesome... I mean, why is there one here of all places...?"
Chibi Bana: "I have no idea... it's so heavy... Is it always this heavy? But Santiago caught an even bigger one... I still have a long way to go..."
You: "No, this is incredible! And hey, we didn't even need the net after all!"
Chibi Bana: "Yeah... I mean... with this our total weight has surpassed yours."
You: "...You're right."
Chibi Bana: "With this I could legally toss you into the ocean..."
You: "That wouldn't stand in a court of law! Please stop! I'm begging you!"
Chibi Bana: "...Well, fine then. I'm in a good mood now. But as punishment for insulting me, help me clean up."
You: "Is that really okay?"
Chibi Bana: "Of course! We gotta end these things on a good note, you know. Now hurry up and do it. And wash off those spots with that bucket."
Chibi Bana: "Alright, let's go home!"
You: "Carry it?"
Chibi Bana: "You carry it! Obviously! The fish are already gutted, right?!"
You: "By the way, who's going to filet these fish?"
Chibi Bana: "Sis will filet them. But I wonder if she can handle a swordfish..."
You: "Right... Probably there's nothing on YouTube either... how to fillet one..."
Chibi Bana: "I found it."
You: "You did!?"
Chibi Bana: "And plenty of it."
You: "You're right... this is really helpful...!"
Chibi Bana: "Alright! If it's like this, my sis can do it!"
Chibi Bana: "I'm home!"
Tachibana: "Welcome back!"
Tachibana: "Whoa?! What is this?!"
Chibi Bana: "Amazing, right! It's a swordfish! Small, but I caught it!"
Tachibana: "How did you even catch something like this... Did you fish it out? Did you get on a boat?"
Chibi Bana: "No! From the pier! We used sandworms as bait!"
Tachibana: "Is that even possible?!"
Chibi Bana: "Amazing, right? Give me praise, praise me!"
Tachibana: "Oh, wow, wow! Good job, good job..."
Chibi Bana: "And then goby and whiting! These he caught! I'm actually pretty good at this!"
Chibi Bana: "You didn't let a single one slip away, did you?! That's pretty amazing."
You (thinking): "Is this heaven...? Did I do something good in my past life...?"
Tachibana: "This is incredible! Tonight it means swordfish fried rice, right? Goby fried rice! Whiting fried rice!"
You: "Wait, can't we have something else for once? Today of all days!"
Tachibana: "Right... we could do tempura with the goby and whiting... but how on earth do we fillet a swordfish?!"
Chibi Bana: "What about Yamamoto-san who has almost no teeth? He could probably do it, right?"
Tachibana: "Well, he hurt his back... I don't think he can fillet a swordfish right now... He might share later though..."
You: "By the way, I bet there's a video on how to do it."
Tachibana: "Show me... If it's like this, maybe I can do it. There are a bunch of easy-to-understand videos."
Tachibana: "Alright, leave it to me!"
Tachibana: "Yes!"
You: "Is that how you hold a knife?!"
Tachibana: "Of course... this way it's hard to put strength into... "
You: "I see... It might actually make sense."
Tachibana: "You both look tired. I'll cook dinner. Wait here."
Tachibana: "I'm done!"
You: "As expected, fried rice!"
Tachibana: It's ready!
You: Knew it was gonna be fried rice!
Tachibana: But this time it's specialâ€”goes great even with sashimi!
Chibi: Wow, sis! And you even sliced up the tuna perfectly... just from watching a video?
Tachibana: Yeah! The tutorial was super clear. A good guide really makes things easier, huh?
Tachibana: Oh, and I tempuraâ€™d the gobies and whitings you caught too! Perfect size, and none of them swallowed the hook. You've got talent!
Chibi: Nailed it! Seriously, most people donâ€™t catch anything their first time. You did amazing!
You: Ugh...
You (thinking): Maybe I died once and this is heaven... Like, in a past life I saved a cat or something, earned a bunch of karma, and now I'm here...
Chibi: Whatâ€™s up with that face? Why you look like you're gonna cry with this awesome meal in front of you?
Tachibana: ...Did you hate the fried rice that much...? In the Triple Fried Rice Cult, if you donâ€™t eat it once a day, Lady Luck hits you with a death penalty... So please... donâ€™t cry...
You: Thatâ€™s not it...! Wait, there are actual penalties?! You need to leave that cult immediately!
Chibi: When you feel like crying, just eat something good and soak in the bath. Then sleep. Your heart's probably just tiredâ€¦ or itâ€™s the melatonin talking.
Tachibana: Crying means your body still works. If you can cry, you can feel joy. And if you can feel joy, you can be happy. You're built for happiness, you know.
Chibi: Damn, sis really knows how to drop wisdom!
You: ...Thanks. Both of you. Really.
Chibi: Of course, the flip side is I can totally snap too. So watch what you say. Next time you try to talk down to me, you better be ready for consequences.
You: ...Way to ruin the moment. But okay, fair.
Tachibana: Alright everyone! Dig in! These are the fish you two caught!
